positions.comment: Heading north for the Summer - first stop St Simon''s Island Georgia
Safely anchored at St Simon''s Island, Georgia
Plan to leave tomorrow from St Simon''s Island for Bar Harbor, Maine.
Left yesterday from St Simon''s Island, Georgia for Bar Harbor, Maine
Sailing slowly in the Gulf Stream - 885 NM to go  All well aboard
761 nm to go, all well aboard, some thunderstorms
Just past Cape Hatteras - 631 NM to Bar Harbor - Stormy night, no wind now
549 NM to go - thunderstorms last night - then becalmed - Usual WX
Slow progress, beating 50 degrees off course, all well aboard, Send pizza
Sailing - finally - right on course - 400 NM to Mt Desert Island, (Maine)
Winds have died again - Motoring - All well aboard - 355 NM to go
Sailing downwind - finally - 283 NM to go - all well aboard
200 NM to go - Winds northerly - seas calm - all well aboard
120 NM to go - motorsailing, little wind, all well aboard
21 Miles to go - motoring - will arrive Long Island, ME before dark
Safely anchored,  Long Island - entirely surrounded  by Lobster Traps
Safely anchored,  Valley Cove, Mt Desert Island where the Vikings Anchored
Anchored Somesville, Maine - gorgeous harbor - weather perfect - all well aboard
Little Cranberry Island, Beautiful anchorage, Historic, Rugged, Great people
Anchored next to the Eaton Islands - beautiful - all wewll aboard
Holbrook Harbor, Maine - Beautiful - Peaceful -; Enchanted - All well aboard
Safely anchored, Georges Harbor, Maine; WInds calm - for the moment!
Motorsailing towards the Isles of Shoals at the Maine - NH Border
Motoring towards Gloucester in heavy fog - Radar working well
Anchored in Hull Bay near Quincy - Gales now passed - Return Quincy tomorrow
